column5: It works for sport fishing so why not? http://www.cbc.ca/radio/popup/audio/...t-and-release-[satire]&contentid=1.3875393
Sounds like more bears visiting the citizens and the dumps!
Bahahaha! Clearly a joke! Only in Canada. I would have liked the This hour has 22 minutes crew do a video of the adventure. Or better yet, the Trailer Park Boys. Bubble commentary would be legendary!
Funny but here in Minnesota that would actually be illegal. You can shoot and kill an animal but non lethal "hunting" is considered harassment. I always thought that was kind of funny too.

Kinda like an angler keeping a live fish on a stringer for hours, while hoping to land a bigger fish. Releasing that stringered fish after hours of dragging and abuse. It basically dead by then. Waste of a fish.

Aw Shucks. This is old stuff to me. I have been doing catch and release for years in northern Ontario walleye fishing. More recently, I have crossed over to "shoot and release" pheasant hunting in South Dakota. Well, maybe not on purpose...
